title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Canadian National Railway made a roughly $30 billion bid for Kansas City Southern, kicking off a bidding war for a railroad operator that has already agreed to a sale to Canadian Pacific.

---

Netflix said first-quarter subscriber growth was weaker than expected. The firm's shares were 8.4% lower in after-hours trading.

---

Boeing board cast a vote of confidence in CEO Calhoun by extending his job for up to five years. Boeing said CFO Smith will retire in July.

---

Apple unveiled a subscription podcast service that deepens its competition with Spotify, plus upgrades to its iPad and iMac lines.

---

Foxconn is scaling back plans for an LCD plant in Wisconsin, saying it expects to invest a fraction of the $10 billion promised nearly four years ago.

---

P&G said it would start charging more for household staples this fall, as it posted 4% growth in organic sales.

---

U.S. stocks fell, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq retreating 0.7%, 0.8% and 0.9%, respectively.

---

Toshiba rebuffed a takeover proposal from private-equity firm CVC, saying the overture didn't provide enough detail.

---

Chat startup Discord has halted talks to sell itself to potential suitors including Microsoft as it resumes interest in a potential IPO.

---

The Daily Mail's owner filed an antitrust suit against Alphabet's Google.
